other_tests.findings: Revealed a monoclonal IgM and polyclonal IgG, characterized as type II cryoglobulinemia.
Showed chronic axonal damage with massive perivascular infiltration of numerous mononuclear cells.
Revealed MPGN with suspected cryoglobulinemic renal damage.

Indicated abnormal lymphocytes accounting for approximately 2%, and further follow-up showed 4.07%. Flow cytometry showed small and medium B lymphocytes occupying 3% then 1.11% of nucleated cells; abnormal plasma cells were 0.37% then 0.10%.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased abnormal lymphocyte count from approximately 2% to 4.07%.
